subchapters.content: This section provides principles, requirements and guidance for the construction phase of the project which shall be considered and addressed at the design stage. The construction phase includes manufacturing, load-out, transport, installation and commissioning; de-commissioning shall also be taken into consideration. Sections of this standard containing important information related to construction include: Sec.3 Arrangement principles and Sec.8 Access and transfer.

requirements: Outline a realistic project programme with adequate time for planning and execution.
Early identify and reduce risks.
Minimise work required offshore by completing work onshore including partial commissioning and testing.
Facilitate co-operation between parties involved in construction.
Adopt a risk-based construction design considering safety, environmental consequences, and total life cycle costs.
Evaluate the design regarding its suitability to meet performance criteria, including lost time injuries.
Consider all activities required for fabrication and construction onshore as well as load-out and transportation.
Comply with DNV-OS-C401 Fabrication and testing of offshore structures unless otherwise agreed.
Deliver steel materials and products with inspection documents as defined in EN 10204 or equivalent standard.
Increase material certificate level for secondary structures important for the safety of personnel.
Define general requirements on manufacturing and the qualification of manufacturers in DNV-SE-0073 and DNV-SE-0190.
Perform testing and commissioning of the substation electrical system in three stages: factory acceptance tests, harbour acceptance tests, site acceptance tests.
Perform factory acceptance tests to check conformity with specifications and functional requirements, including major substation power equipment such as transformers and switchgears.
Carry out harbour acceptance tests on systems or modules after assembly and installation at the construction yard, including extensive checks on auxiliary power systems.
Conduct site acceptance tests to ensure proper installation and interface of systems upon offshore installation.
Verify tightness of electrical connections and proper functional operation before main power energization offshore.
Cover planning principles, risk evaluation, and documentation for transport and installation operations.
Include operational prerequisites such as design criteria, weather forecast, organization, method statements, operation manuals, preparation, and testing.
Document acceptable characteristics for handled objects, equipment, temporary or permanent structures, vessels, etc.
Perform load analysis taking into account dynamic effects, nonlinear effects, permanent loads, live loads, deformation loads, environmental loads, and accidental loads.
Define environmental loads and load cases, on-bottom stability requirements, and requirements for structural strength.
Consider operational aspects for ballasting, pile installation, and grouting.
Follow guidance and recommendations for lifting operations in DNV-ST-N001 and ensure compliance with International Regulations for Prevention of Collision at Sea (COLREG).
Ensure subsea cable pull-in and connection are considered in the design phase, including support of cable during installation and operation.
Include quality records, material test certificates, approval documents, construction procedures, method statements, and construction log.
Document inspection records, description of non-conformities, and as-built drawings.
Ensure as-built drawings contain the same level of detail as the approved design drawings.

checklist: Outline project programme with adequate time for planning and execution.
Early identification and reduction of risks.
Minimize offshore work by maximizing onshore commissioning and testing.
Facilitate cooperation between construction parties.
Adopt risk-based design considering safety, environmental consequences, and life cycle costs.
Evaluate design to meet performance criteria.
Comply with DNV-OS-C401 for onshore fabrication and construction.
Deliver steel and products with EN 10204 inspection documents.
Increase material certificate level for important secondary structures.
Test major substation components as per IEC standards.
Document construction yard acceptance tests and commissioning.
Follow guidelines for manufacturing and equipment qualification.
Execute factory, harbour, and site acceptance tests.
Verify electrical connections and perform functional checks before offshore energization.
Include comprehensive planning and documentation for transport and installation.
Document characteristics and perform load analysis for transport elements.
Consider operational aspects for ballasting, pile installation, and grouting.
Adhere to DNV-ST-N001 for lifting operations and COLREG for navigational compliance.
Document as-built construction quality, inspection records, and non-conformities.
Prepare detailed as-built drawings.
